abstracts.cdata!:
The resettlement action plan for the
            Western Poverty Reduction Project in China deals with the
            two components, rural enterprises and infrastructure
            construction, that need to acquire land. The objective of
            the project is to alleviate chronic poverty for the absolute
            poor living in remote and inaccessible villages of Gansu and
            Qinghai Provinces and Inner Mongolia Autonomous Region. Each
            of the three areas has created a separate plan dealing with
            resettlement and compensation. In Inner Mongolia, there are
            no foreseen problems in borrowing land for the
            infrastructure construction component (rural roads). Within
            the Gansu province, 9,552 people will be affected among 28
            townships. The Qinghai project will include voluntary
            resettlement for 57,775 people in the region, although the
            impact of land acquisition and land use change on the sparse
            local population is small with no housing, wells, fences, or
            other fixed assets affected.
